title: 107_s1586
content: Carrying of firearms by licensee employees. Chapter 14 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to authorize certain individuals to carry firearms in the performance of official duties at facilities owned or contracted to the United States. This includes employees of contractors and subcontractors engaged in property protection, as well as employees of persons licensed or certified by the Commission involved in protecting designated facilities or property of significance to the common defense. Chapter 14 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to authorize individuals to carry firearms in the protection of property at facilities owned or operated by a Commission licensee or certificate holder, as necessary for common defense and security. "Individuals are authorized to carry firearms for the protection of property at facilities owned or operated by a Commission licensee or certificate holder, as necessary for defense and security." "Authorized individuals can arrest without a warrant for US offenses committed in their presence or felonies if there is reasonable belief. Contractors or license holders' employees can only arrest within the area of the offense." The law allows for the arrest of individuals who commit offenses directly from the area of the offense. This includes enforcement of laws related to property of the United States under the custody of specific departments or license holders designated by the Commission. The law allows for the arrest of individuals who commit offenses related to property under the custody of license holders designated by the Commission. The arrest authority is in addition to any other existing arrest authority under the law. Guidelines will be issued to implement this section. The Energy Act of 1954 is amended to include new provisions related to chapter 14. The Energy Act of 1954 is amended to include new provisions related to carrying firearms, unauthorized introduction of dangerous weapons, and sabotage of nuclear facilities or fuel. Section 236a of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to include provisions related to storage, treatment, disposal facilities, utilization facilities licensed under the Act, nuclear fuel fabrication facilities, production, waste storage, waste treatment, waste disposal, uranium enrichment, and nuclear fuel. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to include provisions related to storage, treatment, disposal facilities, and nuclear fuel fabrication facilities subject to licensing or certification. If there is a significant possibility of destruction or damage that could adversely affect public health and safety during the operation of the facility, action must be taken.
